About

Statistics 426 is a class taught in the Statistics Department at Brigham Young University. In this class, we cover the data science pipeline including collecting and wrangling data, version control, analyzing, evaluating and interpreting machine learning models, and ethics and bias. The class this semester is taught by Shannon Tass.


Check out our class blog and class projects!
